name: 4,5,6,7-tetrachloro-2-phenyl-1,3-benzodioxole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1978
Reason: 4,5,6,7-tetrachloro-2-phenyl-1,3-benzodioxole has a melting point of 120.0 degrees Celsius. The presence of chlorine atoms increases the melting point due to their high electronegativity and ability to form strong intermolecular interactions. Each chlorine atom can increase the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius, resulting in a total increase of +80 degrees Celsius.
